photo.description: I hadn't really appreciated FF Typestar (by Steffen Sauerteig of eBoy fame) until I saw it used hugely for the identity and signage of Berlin's "Museum Island" (Museumsinsel). This version is slightly customized â the most extreme glyphs ('r', 't', and 'y') were tamed. Sabon is the serif. Design by Polyform.
photo.tags: fontsinuse sabon fftypestar typestar fonttypestar designerstefansauerteig foundryfontfont type:face=fftypestar type:face=typestar

Seu nome Ã© uma homenagem ao primeiro curador, Wilhelm von Bode, em 1956. Abriga uma coleÃ§Ã£o de esculturas, arte bizantina, moedas e medalhas. A coleÃ§Ã£o de esculturas mostra a arte da Cristandade Oriental (com Ãªnfase na Igreja Ortodoxa Copta, no Egito), esculturas do ImpÃ©rio Bizantino e Ravenna, Idade MÃ©dia, do GÃ³tico italiano e do comeÃ§o do Renascimento. Obras alemÃ£s do final do GÃ³tico estÃ£o representadas por Tilman Riemenschneider, pela RenascenÃ§a do sul da Alemanha e pelo barroco prussiano atÃ© o sÃ©culo XVIII. Abriga tambÃ©m uma das maiores coleÃ§Ãµes de numismÃ¡tica do mundo, de moedas que remetem ao comeÃ§o da Casa da Moeda, na AnatÃ³lia do sÃ©culo VII AC atÃ© moedas atuais. SÃ£o mais de 750 mil itens.
photo.title: Bodemuseum, Museumsinsel.

photo.description: Okay not really, but that was the first thing I thought of. Perhaps it comes from playing Hero's Quest when games still game on floppy drives..
photo.title: Baba yaga!
The main hall of the Bode Museum

photo.description: Gregorian music... I thought it was funny
photo.title: Ceci n'est pas un folio

photo.description: (Are you one of the people who gets this joke, or the masses that don't?)
photo.title: Look out! It's a raygun

photo.description: The spirit of christmas captured in precious metals. It even has a pine tree... I adored this piece.
photo.title: Christmas all year round

photo.description: We were kind of confused by this door...
photo.title: Umm....

photo.description: The Bode Musuem had horrendous lighting, but I figured I'd shoot this anyway. The figure of Artemis (=Diana) holds moderate symbolic meaning for someone who I care about lots.
photo.title: Artemis

photo.description: This is the most "made to look inconspicuous" wheelchair access thingy I've seen so far in my life. Go, Bode Museum.
photo.title: Accessibility win

photo.description: Which did you see first, squares or diamonds?
photo.title: Optical challenge

photo.description: Okay this title's a bit... specific - If you've ever watched the "Slayers" animation (a japanese animated show from the mid 90's) then this should make sense to you, and draw a smile... provided you remember a specific girl with a monster fixation, a fictional god, and physically impossibly side-curled hair. If you haven't, this probably means absolutely nothing to you and I can only say "I'm sorry"
photo.title: Zoroaster!

photo.description: I liked the doorway, and the victory was a funny bonus.
photo.title: A victory door
The main hall of the Bode Museum
